==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|じょう|ふ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうふ'}} compound {{m|ltc|情夫|tr=*dzhiɛng *bio}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|情夫|tr=qíngfū}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|じょ|うふ}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[d͡ʑʲo̞ːɸɯᵝ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|じょうふ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しょうふ'|dated}} a male [[lover]], a male [[fling]], a [[paramour]]

====Usage notes====
Specifically refers to an [[extramarital]] male [[lover]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Dated overtones. Implies a secret relationship. Generally being replaced in modern usage by the term {{ja-l|愛人||aijin}}.<ref name="KDJ"/>

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-l|隠し男|かくしおとこ|kakushi otoko}}: literally ''[[hidden]] [[man]]''
* {{ja-l|色男|いろおとこ|iro otoko}}: literally ''"[[colorful]]" [[man]]'' {{qualifier|alluding to a sexual relationship}}
* {{ja-l|愛人|あいじん|aijin}}: a [[lover]] {{qualifier|often, but not necessarily, refers to an extramarital relationship}}
* {{ja-l|間男|まおとこ|maotoko}}: a [[paramour]], a [[man]] on the side

====Related terms====
* {{ja-l|情婦|じょうふ|jōfu}}: a female [[lover]], a female [[fling]], a [[mistress]] {{qualifier|specifically refers to an extramarital female lover}}
